page.title: 16WORSTON RIDING SCHOOL
page.content: The proprietor of the stables runs a riding school and livery yard. Some of the horses are hers and she houses others. The horses at livery are kept for the owner and fed and groomed for a fixed price, currently between Â£28 and Â£53 per week. Young horses can be broken in here. These days one can pay about Â£175 for a suitable horse for a child and about Â£3,000 for a horse for cross-breeding. The stables proprietor also takes part in the sport of driving: 2 or 4 horses pulling a 2-passenger vehicle around an obstacle course. Driving has been popularised by the Duke of Edinburgh. Sometimes she drives in a procession and occasionally the carriages are used to transport a newly-married couple to their reception.
